greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of pairwise coprime strict compositions of n, where a singleton is not considered coprime unless it is (1).
link: Fausto A. C. Cariboni, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..600
example: The a(1) = 1 through a(9) = 12 compositions (empty column shown as dot):
xref: A220377*6 counts these compositions of length 3.
A337462 is the not necessarily strict version.
A000740 counts relatively prime compositions, with strict case A332004.
A051424 counts pairwise coprime or singleton partitions.
A101268 considers all singletons to be coprime, with strict case A337562.
A178472 counts compositions with a common factor > 1.
A327516 counts pairwise coprime partitions, with strict case A305713.
A333228 ranks compositions whose distinct parts are pairwise coprime.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Sep 18 2020
